flow.descriptionCdata:
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.03616ba3-e2dc-4d7e-9bdb-9bd664d5f143.prompt=Hostname 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.228c6133-7e42-4b5c-8438-50b4c80e1fdd.prompt=HostName\: 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.23436a86-91b7-452b-83d1-5227b4cdd0dd.prompt=Password\: 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.2d61c6a5-0263-4367-90c0-d76cf22d1ff2.description=
Checks to see whether or not a connection exists, and if it exists checks to see if it is adequately reliable.

Inputs\:
host - The host to ping from.
username - The username for host.
password - The password for host.
lossThreshold - What percentage of packet loss you consider to be acceptable for this connection.
latencyThreshold - How long (in milliseconds) you consider to be an acceptable latency for this connection.
target - The host to ping.
characterSet - The character encoding of the target computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.

Responses\:
success - The test passed.
diagnosed - A problem was found.
failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
2. Recommended Thresholds\:
Connection Type		Loss Threshold (%)	Latency Threshold (ms)
DSL modem			2		200
Cable modem		2		200
dialup modem		2		500
ISDN Line			2		150
T1/T3/OCR			2		80
10 ethernet			2		10
Wireless			2		600
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.32051a19-f4ff-4bae-b9f3-a7116af48758.description=
This operation loops as many times as specified in the "count" input, counting from "1" to a greater number, incrementing it by "1" at each iteration.

Inputs\:
    count - The number of loops to complete.
Valid values\: from 1 to 9223372036854775807
    reset - Specifies whether the counter restarts counting from "1".
Valid values\: true, false
Default value\: false
    to - The number to count to. It will take the value of the "count" input field. 
    from - The number to start counting at. For this operation, it is customized to "1".
    incrementBy - The number to increment by while counting. For this operation, it is customized to "1".

Results\:
    resultString – This is the primary output. It contains the value of the number that was just counted.

Responses\:
    has more – The counting process is not complete. One or more iterations are pending.
    no more – The counting process is complete.
    failure - The operation completed unsuccessfully.

Note\:
1. It is recommended that you do not change the values of the "to", "from" or "incrementBy" input fields.
2. The "from", "to" and "incrementBy" inputs are customized for this operation. Even though you can also customize them, if you need to specify the loop range borders and the increment value, use the "Counter" operation.

Examples\:
1. For a loop with 20 iterations, the following values should be provided for the input fields\:
    count\: 20
    reset\: false (this field can also be left blank, as "false" is the default value)
2. For an infinite loop, the value of "count" should be at least "1" and the value of "reset" should be "true".
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.6760fb79-6892-4e3d-a8e8-76054c560d08.description=
This waits a fixed number of seconds

Inputs\:
	seconds\:        number of seconds to wait

Responses\:
	success\:         Always

Results and Context\:
	There is no result
	Nothing is placed into the context
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.75633513-28a3-422d-b96e-aca1ed25c824.prompt=Password 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.77e6dd11-d571-45fa-b1be-47f9e098bc8e.description=
This waits a fixed number of seconds

Inputs\:
	seconds\:        number of seconds to wait

Responses\:
	success\:         Always

Results and Context\:
	There is no result
	Nothing is placed into the context
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.934e65ed-1159-4fac-ae83-d7188b71d84e.description=
Checks to see whether or not a connection exists, and if it exists checks to see if it is adequately reliable.

Inputs\:
host - The host to ping from.
username - The username for host.
password - The password for host.
lossThreshold - What percentage of packet loss you consider to be acceptable for this connection.
latencyThreshold - How long (in milliseconds) you consider to be an acceptable latency for this connection.
target - The host to ping.
characterSet - The character encoding of the target computer. The default is the RAS machine's default encoding.

Responses\:
success - The test passed.
diagnosed - A problem was found.
failure - Something went wrong.

Notes\:
1.The character encoding specified in the input for characterSet must be compatible for the host and RAS systems, otherwise the command file created to execute the command becomes garbled causing an error while executing.
2. Recommended Thresholds\:
Connection Type		Loss Threshold (%)	Latency Threshold (ms)
DSL modem			2		200
Cable modem		2		200
dialup modem		2		500
ISDN Line			2		150
T1/T3/OCR			2		80
10 ethernet			2		10
Wireless			2		600
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.9e0ad8e5-e76b-42c7-95f7-e9207db8e2f1.prompt=Username 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.c6d295a9-fdfe-4057-af72-e2c9533a32ea.prompt=Host to ping 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.e6b44dd9-78e6-457f-82c7-9de97404defe.prompt=Host to ping 8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.fd895b8a-4c00-4e82-8e1e-6630ac1e1e38.description=
Runs an SSH command

Input Parameters\:
host - hostname or IP address
command - the command to execute
pty - (true, false) whether to use pty (may mangle stdout and stderr if set to true)
username - username to connect as
password - password
privateKeyFile - The absolute path to the private key file for remote host.
timeout - (optional, default 90 seconds) time in milliseconds to wait for the command to complete

Responses\:
success - the command was executed successfully
failure - the command could not be executed

Extra Results\:
STDERR - the STDERR of the command
STDOUT - the STDOUT of the command
8f3bb336-95d4-460d-84c9-ff7794b4ece2.ffd9035c-ed52-48fb-a707-8292c265b5f0.prompt=UserName\:
flow.name: Reboot Server Linux
